content: in repeat row 1-4 until you have 3 sts on your needles half for example if i have 100g of yarn i would after row 4 subtract 2 to give me 98g of yarn and then divide that resulting in 49g 3 work the increase section cast off with preferred cast off until you have used the first ½ of your yarn eg 49 grams 4 work the point 5 work the decrease finishing section 6 block and wear and receive many compliments and take great pleasure in saying oh you weave in all ends with a tapestry needle and block like this thanks it s the thing gently congrats you have a thing i followed this photo below of my wonderful mother working on the thing her first ever knitting pattern is exactly beginning increase section what yours should look like at the halfway point weird as all get out with us 5 3 75mm needles cast on 3 sts row 1 sl1pwisewyif k to end row 2 sl1pwisewyif p to last st k1 row 3 sl1pwisewyif m1r k to end row 4 sl1pwisewyif p to last st k1 row 5 sl1pwisewyif k to last st k1 repeat row 2-5 until you have 50 sts on your needles after row 3 work point point repeat row 4-5 only twice then work row 4 5 row total for a broader point work an additional repeat 7 row total but bear in mind this will use additional yarn 3
